ygData.subject: Evaluation of scenarios

Subject: Evaluation of scenarios

MIME-Version: 1.0
Content-Type: text/plain; charset=ISO-8859-1
Content-Length: 1151
X-Mailer: eGroups Message Poster
From: "Daniel Paul Hightower" <dph_of_rules@...>

As promised, I am getting around to something.

I propose that we evaluate sets of scenarios [15 or fewer and/or where 
the author provides a description of each scenario] using the 
following factors to evaluate individual scenarios:

1)internal navigability - ability to walk around in a scenario without 
getting lost - only 2 examples of sceanrios that don't match this   
criteria, 'The Stairs' from tevfifty and 'The Cellars' from tevfifty.

2)mobility - wide enough spaces to allow either a large slime or a 
fire elemental go through fairly easily.  biggest examles of one that 
doesn't fit: 'The Labrinth"

3)quirks - negative factors.   for example, in most of my scenarios, 
chain lightning can't be used without waiting forever.

If there are more factors for evaluation of individual scenarios, let 
us add them.
What I propose doing for large sets of scenarios is voting in a poll 
[after the scenarios are completely debugged] on existing factors plus 
a few more such as ability to produce a theme.  Afterall, what keeps 
this game going right now is creation of new scenarios and rating new 
scenarios we go appears to be beneficial.
